utterance.speaker: House

utterance.speaker: House

utterance.content: Yes, you are the sum of everything that’s happened to you. And, yes, some events are more relevant than others. But, uh, the only way we can figure out which ones are is to talk. So tell me, what’s on your mind? What do you want?

utterance.speaker: House

utterance.speaker: House

utterance.speaker: Nolan
utterance.content: You have, but –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Isn't extending trust part of the whole "getting me better" thing?

utterance.speaker: Nolan
utterance.content: If you insist on a pass, I'll give it to you. But I know where you're going, and I know you haven't thought it through. We need to sit down, talk about this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Please give me the pass.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: Hello. Who are you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm –

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: Ben, go inside, okay?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You didn't say anything. And now Annie's leaving, and I hear you're going to Arizona.

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: My husband travels to Phoenix a lot. His corporate headquarters are there. We've been wanting to move for years, but we've been tethered here. And now we're not.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't want you to go.

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: I don't want to go. But I can't break up my family. I-I can't leave my children.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I just don't want it to change.

utterance.speaker: Lydia
utterance.content: I'm sorry that I didn't come to say good bye. I thought it ended kind of perfect. I have to go.

utterance.speaker: Nolan
utterance.content: Not the most exciting use of the overnight pass I've ever seen.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She left.

utterance.speaker: Nolan
utterance.content: And...

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm lost.

utterance.speaker: Nolan
utterance.content: I'm gonna write your letter… To the medical board, recommending that they give your license back.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You can't just console me by giving me a lollipop when I skin my knee.

utterance.speaker: Nolan
utterance.content: Well, two things just happened. You got hurt, which means you connected to someone else strongly enough to miss them. And more important… You recognized the pain and came to talk to me, instead of hiding from it in the Vicodin bottle. The fact that you're hurting and you came here, the fact that you're taking your meds and we're talking right now… Come inside and get some sleep. Tomorrow you can start saying your good-byes.

utterance.speaker: Nolan
utterance.content: Today we're here to congratulate Greg. We're proud of him. We wish him well, and we hope…

utterance.speaker: Everyone
utterance.content: To never see him again!

utterance.speaker: Alvie
utterance.content: House!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Back off. People already think we're gay.

utterance.speaker: Beasley
utterance.content: What do you need, Alvie?

utterance.speaker: Alvie
utterance.content: My meds. I want to get better.
